title: Integrate RouteLLM routing adapter into autonomy runtime
description: Add RouteLLM-aware routing hooks in manager/runner with deterministic fallback behavior and explicit configuration surfaces for cost-aware model routing.
acceptance: RouteLLM integration path is configurable and optional
Fallback behavior is deterministic when router is unavailable
Runner/manager unit tests cover routing decision paths

title: Add independent adversarial tests for routing correctness
description: Create independent tests for model-routing correctness under latency spikes, quota pressure, and malformed router responses.
acceptance: Tests cover router timeout, fallback, and malformed payload handling
At least one test demonstrates regression protection for incorrect route selection
Validation commands pass and evidence is recorded

title: Implement NPV-based capacity allocation policy
description: Implement economic policy that decides when to scale lanes/subagents by expected marginal NPV relative to projected model and execution costs.
acceptance: Policy computes marginal NPV with configurable assumptions
Scaling decisions honor budget ceilings and safety limits
Telemetry captures decision rationale and cost/value inputs

title: Add independent policy tests for NPV gates
description: Build tests that challenge economic policy assumptions including false-positive scale-ups, budget exhaustion, and uncertainty penalties.
acceptance: Tests assert no scale-up when marginal NPV is negative
Tests assert correct guardrails under budget and concurrency limits
Validation commands pass and findings are documented

title: Wire lane/subagent scaling controls into supervisor operations
description: Integrate approved NPV decisions into lane start/ensure logic for controlled parallelism increases with rollback safety.
acceptance: Lane scaling controls are gated and reversible
Scale-up and scale-down events are observable in status/dashboard outputs
No regression in existing lane orchestration behavior

title: Finalize release readiness for routing economics profile
description: Complete docs, runbooks, and evidence artifacts proving cost/performance gains and safe autonomy operation.
acceptance: Runbook documents activation, rollback, and stop-loss policy
Validation and metrics evidence is committed under governance standards
Repository passes required quality gates

title: Build local model fleet discovery and benchmarking pipeline
description: Implement autonomous probing/benchmarking for all LM Studio endpoints, publish fleet status artifacts, and wire into monitor/dashboard.
acceptance: Fleet probe captures endpoint health/model inventory across local network nodes
Benchmark suite records latency/success by endpoint+model
Monitor/dashboard surfaces fleet health and benchmark rollups

title: Add auto-sync hooks and canary tests for new local models
description: Implement configurable auto-download hooks for missing target models and run canary performance tests before promoting models into routing policies.
acceptance: Missing target models are detected per endpoint with explicit sync actions
Canary tests gate promotion of newly discovered/downloaded models
Artifacts include pass/fail reasons and recommended routing tier

title: Enforce local-first routing with complexity-aware model tiers
description: Harden route selection to prioritize local models until saturated, then cheaper hosted models, reserving premium hosted models for deep planning/research/review workloads.
acceptance: Routing payloads include complexity objective and local-first hints
Policy fallback order is local -> cheap hosted -> premium hosted
Metrics prove reduced hosted spend at equal or improved task throughput

title: Integrate workhorse controls into collaboration, cost, and dashboard flows
description: Publish runbooks/prompts and dashboard telemetry for local workhorse orchestration, cost optimization, and multi-lane delegation behavior.
acceptance: Objective/prompt/runbook describe autonomous local-workhorse operating mode
Dashboard exposes local fleet health/load alongside routing economics
Lane-level evidence captures utilization and saturation behavior
